Constructor Detail

Plane3D

public Plane3D(javax.vecmath.Point3d point,
               javax.vecmath.Vector3d vector1,
               javax.vecmath.Vector3d vector2)
        throws NoPlaneException
Creates a plane from a point on the plane and two direction vectors. Notice vector1 and vector2 have to be linear independent.

Parameters:
point - - the point on the plane
vector1 - - the first direction vector
vector2 - - the second direction vector
Throws:
NoPlaneException - in case the plane could not be created

Plane3D

public Plane3D(javax.vecmath.Vector3d vector,
               double lambda)
        throws NoPlaneException
Creates a plane form a normal vector and a constant value lambda. Note lambda is thought to be on the left side of the equation. > Ax + By + Cz + D = 0.

Parameters:
vector - - the normal vector of the plane
lambda - - the constant which defines the position of the plane
Throws:
NoPlaneException - in case the plane could not be created

Plane3D

public Plane3D(javax.vecmath.Point3d p1,
               javax.vecmath.Point3d p2,
               javax.vecmath.Point3d p3)
        throws NoPlaneException
Creates a plane form three points which defines the plane.

Parameters:
point - 1
point - 2
point - 3
Throws:
NoPlaneException - in case the plane could not be created
Method Detail

getPlaneParameters

public double[] getPlaneParameters()
Description copied from interface: Plane
Returns the parameters for this plane. The returned array contains of 4 elements, whereas these elements are equal to the parameters of Ax + By + Cz + D = 0 > [A, B, C, D].

Specified by:
getPlaneParameters in interface Plane
Returns:
the parameters for this plane
